page.title: 02Farming 1
page.content: Out of the many farms in the area 3 were visited. { Manor Farm}borders on to the New Forest. The tenant farmers arrived here 49 years ago from Sturminster Newton bringing all their livestock and equipment by train.At first all work in the field was undertaken by horses and it wasn't until 1943 that they had their first tractor.During the{war}Manor Farm was an emergency landing field and at one time 10 planes were parked in the field. Three bombs fell in the fields near by. The farm comprises of 110 acres approximately 1 acre per animal and 40 acres for hay.They have 58 steers and horses altogether. They used to have 70 dairy cattle but now concentrate on {beef cattle}which go to slaughter in Hordle.Stock is gradually being run down prior to retirement this year.
